attributes.action: Order the Director of Public Prosecutions to examine Chilcot Inquiry evidence.
attributes.additional_details:
Section 9 of the Offences Against The Persons Act states:-
" Murder or manslaughter abroad.
Where any murder or manslaughter shall be committed on land out of the United Kingdom, whether within the Queen's dominions or without, and whether the person killed were subject of Her Majesty or not, every offence committed by any subject of Her Majesty in respect of any such case, whether the same shall amount to the offence of murder or of manslaughter.
attributes.background: Whilst Tony Blair may be a former Prime Minister we are all equal under the law in this country. All evidence, including that redacted, should be examined, so as to ascertain whether any offence may have been committed by Tony Blair or any other person.

rejection.details: The decision to examine evidence to ascertain whether a criminal offence may have been committed is one for the police, not the UK Government, Parliament or the Director of Public Prosecutions.
